subject: RE: [junit] Problem loading apache.xerces classes
msgSnippet: Take a look at the junit/runner/exclude.properties file, and add the .jar in there. It should work. For an explaination, look through other messages. Good luck
messageBody:
Take a look at the junit/runner/exclude.properties file, and add the .jar in
there. It should work. For an explaination, look through other messages.
Good luck

-----Original Message-----
From: David V. Olivier [mailto:dolivier@nrlssc.navy.mil]
Sent: Thursday, October 11, 2001 11:13 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Problem loading apache.xerces classes


I have been using JUnit for some time but am new to this mailing list. In
the past I have not had any problems with JUnit loading the necessary
classes. However, I am currently developing an object which uses Apache's
Xerxes module for parsing XML documents. When I attempt to execute the
test I get a linkage error during setup:

java.lang.LinkageError: loader constraints violated when linking
org/w3c/dom/Document class
at
org.apache.xerces.jaxp.DocumentBuilderFactoryImpl.newDocumentBuilder(Documen
tBuilder
FactoryImpl.java:87)
at MetcastDatabaseInterfacePkg.Catalog.<init>(Catalog.java:30)
at MetcastDatabaseInterfacePkg.tests.CatalogTest.setUp(CatalogTest.java:27)

I don't fully understand JUnit's class loader mechanism. Any suggestions
on how to resolve this problem?

Thanks,

David Olivier
